results.title: A Touch of zen
results.creator_credit: Optimum Releasing, Hsia Liang-fang and King Hu
results.brief_description: Made long before “Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon” this wonderful martial arts epic will linger with you both for its atmospheric and mystical images and its lyrical and mysterious storyline. Set during the time of the Ming Dynasty in a rural village outside Peking, the story begins with the artist Ku Shen-chai who lives with his mother in a supposedly haunted, run-down fort. The arrival of a stranger, Ou-Yang Yin, to the village stirs the curiosity within Ku only to be further flamed by the sudden appearance of a beautiful woman named Yang Hui-Ching. Plot and sub-plot are interwoven to form an intricate tale binding the three protagonists in a web of intrigue and mystery. This is not a full-on action-packed martial arts film but the scenes of combat are impressively creative and beautifully performed. Cast includes Hsu Feng, Tien Peng, Hsueh Han, Shih Chun, Pai Ying. Photography by Hua Hui-ying.

results.title: A Touch of the terminals
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Philip Bull
results.brief_description: Its the machine age, computers are taking over - reducing the workforce and increasing productivity. The unemployed can’t afford to buy the products produced and therefore the company can’t sell its products and is losing money. To make money they cull more workers, bring in more machines and again more unemployed who can’t afford to buy. A satirical look at the effects of computers. Cast includes Martin Vaughan, Michael Ross, Ray Anderson, Tony Llewellyn-Jones.

results.title: A Touch of hands (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of Pittsburgh and James T. Crawford
results.brief_description: Documentary on expressive arts therapist, Ed Lilley’s work with a group of emotionally handicapped children as they prepare a puppet show. The children are shown playing group games, preparing the puppets and set, rehearsing and finally performing their show. The aim of this therapy is to allow the children to extend themselves and improve their self images

results.title: A Time to kill
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Arnon Milchan, Michael Nathanson, Hunt Lowry, John Grisham and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: Talented and eager Mississippi lawyer Jake Brigance (Matthew McConaughey) is called upon to defend Carl Lee (Samuel L. Jackson) after he kills the two rednecks responsible for the brutal rape of his ten year old daughter. Carl’s act of retribution unleashes racial tensions in the small community fueled by the tactics of the Ku Klux Klan. Juggling a small, struggling law practice, his family life and attacks by the Klan, Jake reluctantly accepts legal help from law student Ellen Roark (Sandra Bullock). He also appeals to his mentor (Donald Sutherland) and friend (Oliver Platt) for support against an unscrupulous prosecutor (Kevin Spacey). Against the advice from friends, the will of his wife and the wrath of white supremacy, Jake assembles a team committed to fighting against racial intolerance forcing those around him to examine Carl’s actions and motives. Cast also includes Ashley Judd, Kiefer Sutherland, Charles L. Dutton and Brenda Fricker. Based on the novel by John Grisham. Screenplay by Akiva Goldsman. Music composed by Elliot Goldenthal.

results.title: A Time sequence record of the Ash Wednesday fires using news reports as broadcast during the emergency
results.brief_description: A Channel 10 Production on Wednesday 16th 1983 of the Ash Wednesday Bushfires opening with David Johnston on location in the Dandenong Ranges. The report also includes the fires around Adelaide in South Australia with 5DN journalist Murray Nicoll reporting on the situation including the destruction of his own home. Victoria and South Australia suffered extensive damage and loss during the Ash Wednesday Fires which claimed the lives of 75 people, 13 of these were firemen. The devastating fires also claimed 264,000 sheep, 16,690 cattle and 2031 homes.
